title: IFC Multiple Choice Questions – Chapter 15
description: This quiz evaluates key concepts from Chapter 15 of the IFC exam, including benchmarks, fund performance analysis, risk-adjusted return metrics, and interest rate anticipation strategies.

questions.question: What is a benchmark in the context of mutual fund performance?

options.a: The average performance of an investor’s total portfolio
options.b: A personalized investment goal defined by the advisor
options.c: A standard or index used to compare a fund's performance
options.d: A legal document outlining fund restrictions

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an Investment Policy Statement (IPS)?

options.b: To help fund managers avoid compliance breaches
options.c: To outline asset allocation strategy and benchmark targets
options.d: To replace the fund’s prospectus for clients

questions.question: What is the formula for calculating gain/loss on a mutual fund based on NAVPS?
What is the formula for the Sharpe Ratio?
What does a positive Sharpe Ratio indicate about a mutual fund?

options.a: It underperformed relative to the market
options.c: It delivered a return above the risk-free rate per unit of risk
options.d: It is more volatile than the benchmark index

questions.question: What is a benchmark index?

options.a: A security chosen by the investor to compare return
options.c: A market index used to measure fund performance
options.d: The average performance of non-indexed funds

questions.question: Which of the following is a key Canadian mutual fund benchmark?
What is the purpose of a peer group in performance evaluation?

options.a: To create financial plans for retirees
options.b: To ensure every investor receives the same returns
options.c: To compare similar mutual funds with each other

questions.question: What is another term for a peer group of mutual funds?
What is the role of an appraisal firm in the context of mutual fund evaluation?

options.d: Managing pooled funds on behalf of investors

questions.question: Which of the following are well-known appraisal firms?
Which factor can complicate performance comparisons between mutual funds?
Which of the following are considered measures of fund volatility? (Select the BEST answer)

options.a: Beta, standard deviation, Sharpe ratio, alpha
options.b: Cash flow, fund turnover, MER, trailer fees
options.c: NAVPS, T5 slips, index return, performance universe
options.d: Front-end load, MER, ACB, net yield

questions.question: What does standard deviation measure in mutual fund performance?

options.a: How many units are bought during the year
options.b: How closely the fund follows its benchmark
options.c: The average rate of return over 3 years
options.d: The variability of fund returns over time

questions.question: What is a quartile in fund performance?

options.b: A range of years in a fund’s track record
options.c: A ranking system that divides funds into four groups

questions.question: What percentage range falls into the 3rd quartile of a comparison universe?
Which of the following is a drawback of comparison universes?
What is survivorship bias?

options.a: The belief that past performance guarantees future success
options.b: The tendency of managers to choose outperforming funds
options.c: The distortion caused when poorly performing funds are removed from the universe
options.d: The effect of including foreign currency in performance calculation

questions.question: (Rising Rate Environment – Strategy Selection) Your firm forecasts a steep rate hike by the Bank of Canada. As a fixed-income fund manager, you're adjusting portfolio duration to manage risk. Which of the following bond allocations would best fit the interest rate anticipation strategy?

options.a: Increase allocation to long-term zero-coupon bonds
options.b: Shift holdings into short-term T-bills and high-coupon bonds
options.c: Overweight long-term government bonds and GICs
options.d: Switch entirely into equities to avoid bond losses

questions.question: (Falling Rate Environment – Strategy Logic) The Bank of Canada announces three consecutive rate cuts over the next 9 months. A manager using an interest rate anticipation strategy will likely:

options.a: Shift to long-term, low-coupon government bonds
options.b: Increase exposure to short-term T-bills and floating-rate notes
options.d: Convert bond portfolio into dividend-paying preferred shares

questions.question: (Interest Rate Sensitivity Comparison) Which of the following is most sensitive to changes in interest rates?

(Case-Based Allocation) A manager anticipates mild interest rate increases, but still wants to generate some yield from longer maturities. Which of the following is a moderate response under an interest rate anticipation philosophy?

options.b: Blend short-term bonds with medium-term high-coupon bonds
options.c: Shift completely into equity income funds
options.d: Replace bonds with REITs for yield

questions.question: (Applied Logic) If a client wants to benefit from falling interest rates and is comfortable with short-term price volatility, which bond strategy should they choose?
